[shaky voice] I can't believe we actually won. [pause] Three years since they fired me for "causing trouble" and now— [laugh] now a jury just said they were wrong. [relieved] God, when the foreman read that verdict, I thought I was going to pass out right there in the courtroom. [short pause] 

[bitter] They tried to bury me when I raised safety concerns about those pressure valves. Said I was being "alarmist" and "hurting company morale." [angry] Seven people got hurt because of those valves! [pause] Seven families whose lives got turned upside down while corporate just, um... while they just covered it up. 

[very quietly] I keep thinking about Sarah from quality control. [sad] She testified for them. We used to have lunch together every day for five years, and she sat up there and called me "difficult to work with." [sigh] I guess I knew where people's loyalties would fall when the, uh, when the paychecks were on the line. 

[confidently] But we proved it. Every single claim. [excited] The discovery documents alone were damning enough, but when we got their own engineers to admit they knew— [laugh loudly] Did you see Henderson's face when his own email got projected on that screen? [smiling speaking] "Acceptable risk parameters," he called it. 

[very sincerely] This isn't about revenge. [pause] Okay, maybe a little. [chuckle] But mostly it's about those families getting justice and making sure they can't do this again. [relieved] Finally. Finally someone listened.

subject: Winning your first case as a product liability attorney against your former employer
